name: The clown fish
trivia: Do you know the animators of "Finding nemo" studied dogs’ facial expressions and eyes to animate the fishes’ expressions?

name: Butterfly fish
trivia: Do you know there are 114 species of butterfly fish?

name: Gold fish
trivia: Do you know gold fishes can recognize faces?

name: Tiger barb
trivia: Tiger barbs can swim fast and  they like to spend their time by chasing other tiger barbs.

name: Squid
trivia: Some species of squid can swim at speeds up to 25 miles per hour, as fast as some sharks.

name: Octopus
trivia: Do you know octopuses have 3 hearts and they have blue blood?

name: Angel fish
trivia: Do you know if an angelfish's partner dies, then it has no interest in finding another partner?

name: Crab
trivia: Do you know a crab's eyestalks can move in different directions which allow it to see all around?

name: Star fish
trivia: Do you know starfishes have 2 stomachs and can regenerate their arms.

name: Carp fish
trivia: Do you know carp fish can grow very big? The largest carp on record weighs 222lbs.

name: Electric fish
trivia: Electric fishes have large brain-to-body size ratios and can use their electric discharge to communicate social status

name: Discus fish
trivia: Discus fish is a perhaps the most beautiful tropical fish and known as the King of the Aquarium

name: Betta fish
trivia: Most Betta fish in aquariums are red and blue in color. But, wild bettas are brown or green.

name: Sea horse
trivia: Did you know the male sea horse bears the unborn young? This is rare in the animal kingdom.

name: Sea environment
trivia: Sea is a new level. You can unlock new fishes for the sea.

name: Blue tang
trivia: If you are a shark, never eat blue tang fish. Blue tang is Paracanthurus hepatus, a poisonous fish.

name: Jelly fish
trivia: Do you know jellyfish have been on Earth for millions of years, even before dinosaurs?

name: Green Crab
trivia: A carb's shell protects the soft abdomen, and hydrates the gills so that it can breathe well.

name: Red Crab
trivia: Do you know a crab somtimes wants another crab's shell, then a shell fight triggers?

name: Achovies
trivia: Anchovies are found in temperate waters, and are rare in very cold or very warm seas.

name: Bubbles
trivia: Bubbles is in the fishtank gang. Like a playful puppy obsessed with a toy, he is enamored with bubbles.

name: Salmon
trivia: Do you know salmons can jump two yards into the air?

name: Deep undersea fish
trivia: Deepsea fishes live below 1000 meter of the sea level where no sunlight can reach. They can generate light biologically

name: Sword fish
trivia: Do you sword fishes can swim up to 60 miles per hour

name: Shark
trivia: Do you most sharks species will drown if they stop moving?

name: Dophin
trivia: Dolphins communicate with each other by clicking, whistling and other sounds.

name: Whale
trivia: Do you know that many whales are toothless?

name: Stingray fish
trivia: Ancient Greeks extracted venom from stingray spines and use it as an anaesthetic.

name: Igloo
trivia: You unlocked the tundra level

name: Penguin
trivia: No penguins live at the North Pole.

name: Seal
trivia: When they are on the land, they live in huge colonies with over one thousand other seals!

name: Snow Bunting
trivia: Snow buntings have been called 'snowflakes' because flocks look like snowflakes as they swirl through the air and then settle on winter fields.

name: Grey Wolf
trivia: Living in the Arctic Circle, the Arctic wolf spends five out of twelve months in total darkness.

name: Hare
trivia: During winter, artic hare's white fur allows them to blend into the snow. In spring, their coat turns blue-gray to match the landscape.

name: Pingu, the Penguin
trivia: The earliest known penguin fossil was found in 61.6 million-year old  rock. Some fossil penguins were much larger than any penguin  today, reaching 4.5 feet tall!

name: Reindeer
trivia: Male reindeer lose their antlers in November but females keep theirs much longer.

name: Grey Husky
trivia: Living in the Arctic Circle, the Arctic wolf spends five out of twelve months in total darkness.

name: Snow
trivia: You have unlocked the snow button.

name: Yeti
trivia: In 2019, Indian mountaineers uncovered a large sets of footprints in the northeastern Himalaya snow which led them to believe the prints belonged to Yeti.

name: Brown Bear
trivia: Brown bears can be found in many habitats, from the fringes of deserts to high mountain forests and ice fields.

name: Snowy Owl
trivia: Did you know female snowy owl is slightly larger than the male of the species?

name: Ducks
trivia: Did you know normal body temperature for ducks is 107.5 degree fahrenheit?

name: Mountain goat
trivia: Did you know mountain goats are only native to North America?

name: Blue Jay
trivia: Blue jays warn other birds of predators by imitating the sound of hawks!

name: Rainforest
trivia: Thank you again for completing your survey. You have now unlocked the new rainforest level.

name: Squirrel
trivia: Squirrels have four front teeth which never stop growing throughout their lives.

name: Jaguar
trivia: Jaguars once roamed all the way to the US-Mexico border. Today, almost all jaguars are found in the Amazon river basin.

name: Venus Flytrap
trivia: It takes roughly 10 days for a venus flytrap to completely digest an insect.

name: Lion
trivia: A lion�' roar can be heard from as far as 5 miles away.

name: Ostrich
trivia: Ostriches formerly occupied Africa south of the rainforest belt. Today common ostriches prefer open land and are native to the savannas.

name: Macaw
trivia: Macaws usually live for around 60 years!

name: Triceratops
trivia: It is believed that fully grown triceratops were about 10 ft tall and weighed anywhere between 6 to 12 tons.

name: Duck
trivia: One of the most rare ducks in the planet, the White-Winged Ducks are on the verge of disappearing from the face of the Earth. They usually inhabit shady rainforests in Asia.

name: Goose
trivia: You’ll only find Orinoco Geese in South America, including the Amazon basin, the Orinoco basin, and in the Pantanal wetlands of southern Brazil and Paraguay.

name: Butterfly
trivia: The 'blue morpho' is among the largest butterflies in the world, with wings spanning from five to eight inches.

name: Rain
trivia: The scent that rain leaves behind is called petrichor.

name: Koala
trivia: Koalas sleep for up to 19 hours per day!

name: Owl
trivia: Owls can rotate their necks 270 degrees.

name: Sparrow
trivia: The song of Pectoral Sparrow is high and thin. It has been described as 'insect-like .. an extremely high, thin, buzzy chit-tic-tzzzzzz, tzzzzzz, tzzzzz.'

name: Vulture
trivia: The king vulture is one of the larger species of vulture (up to 32 inches long). All of the other species vultures are quick to move aside for the 'king.'
